annotations.description: There wasn't a lot of action on the pitch. We could describe the game as average. The Real Madrid fans must be pleased with the performance of their team. They were absolutely the better of the two sides. The hosts tried to catch the opposition off guard and hit them on the break. The visiting side kept the ball at their feet and the main intention was to produce that final killer pass.

sends a cross into the box, but the opposition's defence quickly intercepts the ball. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Real Madrid.

annotations.description: Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) is booked for saying more than Jesus Gil Manzano was willing to tolerate.

Takashi Inui (Eibar) gets into a good shooting position. He wins some space for himself and drills a long range daisy cutter towards the middle of the goal. His good effort is, however, superbly saved by Keylor Navas!

annotations.label: y-card
annotations.description: Pepe (Real Madrid) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Jesus Gil Manzano didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Sergio Enrich (Eibar) comes close to scoring. He meets a lovely lofted pass from Takashi Inui, but sends his close range header way over the crossbar.

annotations.label: corner

Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) decides to have a shot at goal from the free kick, but it hits the defensive wall.
Ander Capa (Eibar) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Jesus Gil Manzano signals. That's a free kick to Real Madrid.

Sergio Enrich (Eibar) is picked out by one of his teammates with a brilliant long range cross, but he doesn't control the ball well and the defence eliminates the danger without any problem.
Takashi Inui (Eibar) serves up a nice cross, but Keylor Navas punches the ball away.
Cristiano Ronaldo (Real Madrid) does his best to latch onto a cross into the box, but he can't get to the ball.
Daniel Carvajal (Real Madrid) delivers a long ball, but it lacks enough power to reach his teammates and is intercepted by one of the defenders.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Everything is set for the start of the second half.

We are watching a run of the mill game with only a few moments to ignite the crowd. The players surely can surely perform better, they just need to motivate themselves. Real Madrid have arguably been the better of the two sides in the first half. The home side is creating their opportunities using lightning fast counter attacks. The tactic of the away side is slow build up play.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Jesus Gil Manzano has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.

annotations.label: corner
annotations.description: The ball is whipped in from the corner by James Rodriguez (Real Madrid), but one of the defenders gets it clear.

Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) receives a lofted pass and is given time inside the box to unleash a shot goalwards. The ball is directed to the bottom left corner, but it lacks power and Asier Riesgo pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort. The linesman points to the corner flag, Real Madrid are going to take it.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: It's a goal! Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) makes it 0:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Luka Modric and planted his close range header into the left side of the goal. Asier Riesgo was helpless.
